de.frankfurt.uni.vcp.nodes
Class DesertHeightMap

java.lang.Object
  com.jme3.scene.Spatial
      com.jme3.scene.Node
          de.frankfurt.uni.vcp.nodes.DesertHeightMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme3.asset.Asset, com.jme3.collision.Collidable, com.jme3.export.Savable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class DesertHeightMap
extends com.jme3.scene.Node

Visual-Computing Praktikum - Aufgabe 2.

This class provides the HeightMap used to draw the topology of the terrain.

The generating the terrain requires two steps:

  1. Generating one image for the HeightMap...
  2. ...and to generate an alphamap tp map appropiate textures for different heights within the surface

Author:
Bernd Spï¿½th, Wladimir Spindler and Saman Sedighi Rad

public DesertHeightMap(MapConfig mapConfig,
                       com.jme3.asset.AssetManager assetManager)
                throws java.io.IOException
Creates the complete desert terrain for the map.

Parameters:
mapConfig - This holds the logical information of the topology of the terrain that is supposed to be generated.
assetManager - Used to for the required Material and Texture for the terrain.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

addHeight

private void addHeight(java.awt.Graphics2D heightMapImage,
                       java.awt.Graphics2D alphaMapImage,
                       float radius,
                       int i,
                       int j,
                       int location)
Adds one single spot which represent an raising height within the terrain.
This is required for the heightmap and the alphamap with the exakt same value but different colors.

Parameters:
heightMapImage - Image which holds the grayscale heightmap image.
alphaMapImage - Image which holds the colored alphamap for the textures.
radius - Radius on the raising.
i - Horizontal logical index.
j - Vertical logical index.
location - The location of the raising area.
